sections.heading: Student Advising Services advises undergraduate students who are:

bullet_points.3: Prehealth: students preparing for admission to medicine, dentistry, optometry, podiatry, veterinary, and chiropractic schools.

bullet_points.5: Prelaw: students preparing for admission to law school.

paragraphs.1: Students with intended or approved majors should use the Advising Directory to locate the appropriate academic advising center for assistance.

bullet_points.1: Providing academic advice for students â€” especially those who are exploring majors (undecided) through our Major Explorers Program/Class.

bullet_points.2: Guiding students in making an informed decision about selecting a major by 45 completed credit hours.

bullet_points.3: Assisting students in developing a holistic academic plan that meets degree requirements and incorporates experiential learning such as internships and study abroad.

bullet_points.4: Ensuring students understand academic policies/procedures and their implications.

bullet_points.5: Helping students who want or need to transition from an existing major, by exploring new majors while still achieving timely graduation.

bullet_points.7: Evaluating alternative and military experiences for university credit.

paragraphs.1: Student Advising Services' mission is to assist University at Buffalo undergraduate students of all backgrounds in the discovery and development of their academic goals through advising.
